textAfterTable: Showing 4 results of 4 Flat | Threaded Re: [smartmontools-support] smartctl says I have 88 uncorrected blocks, but test don't find them From: Rich <rercola@ac...> - 2012-09-25 18:38:01 All of this is purely the drive - smartd, smartctl, and friends can issue information requests or test requests to the drive, but all that information is the drive's responsibility. So if the drive stopped updating its bad block counter, the only one you can ask about there being a problem...is the drive. :I - Rich On Tue, Sep 25, 2012 at 2:31 PM, Silas Silva <silas.silva@...> wrote: > On Tue, Sep 25, 2012 at 02:27:35PM -0400, Rich wrote: >> It'd be nice to know what kind of hard drive this is. >> >> That said, if it marked those as offline uncorrectable, it may have >> not updated the pending sector count, and then indeed, the drive is >> "fine" - one or two bad sectors do not a bad drive make. A rapidly >> increasing number, on the other hand... > > Hi Rich, > > It is a stable number. > > Actually, let me tell you all the history.
